TopicTitle: Atlas Spacecraft Systems (Stockalike VASIMR and Argon Tanks)

Articles.Content:
![5ewj85C.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5ewj85C.jpg)

Stockalike VASIMR and argon tanks

**Download**

[![vQdc1yt.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/vQdc1yt.png?1)](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/940/SmallFatTechnologies)

**Known Bugs**

- Kerbal Engineer doesn't recognize power change

- Atmosphere curve doesn't work

- No FX

**ATTENTION- This release is most likely buggy and unbalanced. I would recommend that you do not use this in a career save.**

**Parts**

**Vasimr**

The VASIMR rocket uses radio waves to ionize argon, and accelerates the superheated gas out of the nozzle using magnetic fields. It can be used at a high efficiency, low thrust mode, or a lower efficiency, higher thrust mode. However, it requires huge amounts of electricity to function.

![8xOzlJW.png?3](http://i.imgur.com/8xOzlJW.png?3)![yHCS7YY.png?2](http://i.imgur.com/yHCS7YY.png?2)![Ssjmb1V.png?2](http://i.imgur.com/Ssjmb1V.png?2)![DwWq7pK.png?2](http://i.imgur.com/DwWq7pK.png?2)

Liquid argon has a boiling point of -185Ã‹Å¡C, compared to oxygen at -183Ã‹Å¡C and hydrogen at -252Ã‹Å¡C.

It's density is 1.39g/cm^3, close to liquid oxygen's 1.141g/cm^3.

**Fuel tanks**

I made some custom tanks, but the parts made by Porkjet that I was using for inspiration were unused and far superior to anything I could make in the near future. They had no license, so I was free to use them. I have sent Porkjet a PM asking for permission to put my VASIMR and these tanks in a download together, and have not gotten a response yet. **We're good to go!**

![mmomFnA.png](http://i.imgur.com/mmomFnA.png)

![CHX0vTD.gif](http://i.imgur.com/CHX0vTD.gif)

<iframe data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/?app=core&module=system&controller=embed&url=https%3A%2F%2Fgfycat.com%2FSmallHighlevelCatfish" style="height:885px;"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 
> This tank would inflate using argon from full tanks on your ship. it would allow you to save space and pack your ship into a smaller fairing for launch
> 
> 

![xzyrVj3.jpg?2](http://i.imgur.com/xzyrVj3.jpg?2)

> 
>  

**Nuclear Reactor+Radiators**

Will happen eventually.

**How this is different from NFT**

Really, it isn't. I made this to try my hand at modding ksp. If people like it, I will try to make it more unique and different.

**Credits**

The argon tanks were made by [Porkjet](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/94951-Porkjet), not me. The NearFuturePropulsion plugin was made by [Nertea](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/86292-Nertea). Go give 'em some rep!

**Please, suggest anything that you want below. I love hearing your ideas!**

~SmallFatFetus

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-22T18:04:46Z" title="08/22/2016 06:04  PM" data-short="7 yr">August 22, 2016</time> by SmallFatFetus**
Well if you make it compatable with NFP I'm sure loads of people would like the variate it brings.

I'm agree. Selfsufficient VASIMR mod is very good for many people but option to make it NFT-compatible will make it great! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

PS models looking good, but isn't VASIMR nozzle must be simply conical?

![o_1076171.jpg](http://cdn.static1.rtr-vesti.ru/p/o_1076171.jpg)![The-VX-200-prototype-VASIMR-engine-that-could-potentially-be-apart-of-the-next-Mars-mission..jpg](http://scinotech.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/The-VX-200-prototype-VASIMR-engine-that-could-potentially-be-apart-of-the-next-Mars-mission..jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T09:33:12Z" title="06/16/2015 09:33  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by ZobrAA**
It probably is. I just decided to make mine a little different and maybe more interesting.

These models look really fantastic, especially the inflatable tanks looks interesting. What kind of License will you mod have? I would like to add them to KSPI-E

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T17:44:16Z" title="06/16/2015 05:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by FreeThinker**
Can you make variants in 1.25 m, 0.625m, and maybe a large 2.5 m one? And also only make 2.5 and 3.75 m nuclear reactors, as I think 1.25 m is too small.
These look really, really, nice. I can't wait for the release.

> 
> And also only make 2.5 and 3.75 m nuclear reactors, as I think 1.25 m is too small.

The U.S. Navy operated a [small research submarine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_submarine_NR-1) that was nuclear powered. Her core was fairly small, probably about the size of a 55 gallon drum.
Pretty cool! Will enjoy seeing it ingame ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
That looks quite nice actually. Looking forward t seeing these in my parts list ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif).

Alright everyone, I have fixed up some of Porkjet's old argon tanks!

![mmomFnA.png](http://i.imgur.com/mmomFnA.png)

These may end up in the release or I might replace them with my own models eventually. See the OP for more info.

Also, I got the VASIMR in the game! it currently has some wonky stats, but it is fueled by electric charge and argon.

Stay Tuned!

Just alittle boo boo in your files your tanks don't show up you have 

    MODEL{	model = [COLOR="#FF0000"]StockalikeVasimr[/COLOR]/Parts/argonTanks/Ar1-4R	texture = tanks_AR, [COLOR="#FF0000"]StockalikeVasimr[/COLOR]/Parts/argonTanks/tanks_AR	texture = tanks_NRM, [COLOR="#FF0000"]StockalikeVasimr[/COLOR]/argonTanks/tanks_NRM}

 Shouldn't it be 

    MODEL{	model = [COLOR="#0000FF"]SmallFatTechnology[/COLOR]/Parts/argonTanks/Ar1-4R	texture = tanks_AR, [COLOR="#0000FF"]SmallFatTechnology[/COLOR]/Parts/argonTanks/tanks_AR	texture = tanks_NRM, [COLOR="#0000FF"]SmallFatTechnology[/COLOR]/argonTanks/tanks_NRM}

Ah! Thank you! I Completely forgot I had to change that after I changed the folder name. I'm fixing and reuploading now.

EDIT: Hotfixed!

Thank you! I didn't use DDS because I'm not sure how to export it in unity, plus I didn't want to over-complicate things. Next release will most likely have it.

I modeled and uv unwrapped a reactor yesterday. It's done in Nertea's style, filling the gap between the 1.25m reactor and the 2.5m reactor, which is very tall. So here's a quick render, prior to texturing:![fzm3G2p.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/fzm3G2p.png?1)

And a textured render will come later.

Here it is!
